description: A library of code used for training on XOD at www.biomaker.org
name: malibrary

HkDexyzSHMm.content: light a led if there is an error

@/auto-scale-for-seven-segment-display.description:
Prepares input numbers for display on  the seven-segment display.
Rescales values and calculates where to show the decimal point and negative sign. Acceptable input values -999 to 9999

H1HekfSBGQ.description: Integer value correcponding to imput value
H1HekfSBGQ.label: NOUT

rypXfBrGm.description: Input number is out of range
rypXfBrGm.label: ERR

@/buttonselect.description: used to provide a button select  (as in the Arduino LCD shield) by reading the voltage on an analog port.

B15domm-Q.content:
This node allows to use the buzzer on the Ks0183 keyestudio Multi-purpose Shield V1 http://wiki.keyestudio.com/index.php/Ks0183_keyestudio_Multi-purpose_Shield_V1.

It is just a wrapper around the tone command for Arduino

**Warning** Use of the buzzer will interfere with PWM output on pins 3 and 11 on boards other that Mega

@/buzzer.description: A wrapper around the tone command for Arduino. It allows to use the buzzer on the Ks0183 keyestudio Multi-purpose Shield V1

HJNfKdpP-Q.content:
This node allows to use the buzzer on the Ks0183 keyestudio Multi-purpose Shield V1 http://wiki.keyestudio.com/index.php/Ks0183_keyestudio_Multi-purpose_Shield_V1.

This version requires a pulse input and the buzzer only emits a beep for the duration of T seconds.

**Warning** Use of the buzzer will interfere with PWM output on pins 3 and 11 on boards other that Mega

@/buzzer-pulse.description:
This node allows to use the buzzer on the Ks0183 keyestudio Multi-purpose Shield V1 

Like the buzzer, It is just a wrapper around the tone command for Arduino,  but it requires a pulse input and the buzzer only emits a beep for the duration of T seconds.

rkyUsTPZQ.content:
Like the buzzer node, but it also allows for a timed action. A pulse on the SET pin will produce a sound for a time T. It can still be operated continuously using the EN pin. It somehow integrates the two versions of the tone function in Arduino.

Default freq. is 440 Hz, default time is 1 sec

**Warning** Use of the buzzer will interfere with PWM output on pins 3 and 11 on boards other that Mega

@/buzzer-timed.description:
Like the buzzer node, but it also allows for a timed action. A pulse on the SET pin will produce a sound for a time T. It can still be operated continuously using the EN pin. It somehow integrates the two versions of the tone function in Arduino.

Default freq. is 440 Hz, default time is 1 sec

@/count-between.description: Counts between MIN and MAX (included), with steps  ov STEP. If count goes out of range it wraps around.

@/count-to-n.description: Counts from 0 to N -1 then resets and starts again. Each step taks T seconds

BkXVWBNzX.content: Defer is needed in XOS to allow cycles

H1pHrSNzX.content: We could have used a clock and a counter instead

Hy1HbBVGm.content: But the counter is reset to 0 when it reaches 10

rJtMPURzZm.content: This is similar to the gated version, with the addition af a final pulse triggering an update of the led value to zero to actually switch off the led.

ByVp8Rf-Q.content: This is similar to the gated version, with the addition af a final pulse triggering an update of the led value to zero to actually switch off the led.

HyY_Or0fWQ.content: This is similar to the gated version, with the addition af a final pulse triggering an update of the led value to zero to actually switch off the led.

Skh-MjG7bm.content: This is similar to the pure-color ones. The only difference is that it uses the led-rgb node. The output colour is decided by the R-G-B balance in led-rgb node.

@/format-number-to-two-digits.description: If the number is < 10, adds a 0 in front. Used for diplaying  times and dates.

HJKAjp6MWm.content: This is similar to the non-gated version, with the addition af a pulse triggering a single update of the led value in order to avoid conflicts when using more of the same nodes

HJtz10TM-m.content: This is similar to the non-gated version, with the addition af a pulse triggering a single update of the led value in order to avoid conflicts when using more of the same nodes

rJ516pfbQ.content: This is similar to the non-gated version, with the addition af a pulse triggering a single update of the led value in order to avoid conflicts when using more of the same nodes

SJNJAfQ-7.content: An RGB led. It allows to set the value for each of the base colours, to set the ports, and introduces an enable input (true by default). Some logic is needed to generate DONE and ERR output when all three leds are done or at least one is in error.

@/long-press.description: The output goes high only after the input stays high for some time T. It will go back to low when  the input signal goes low.

H1l9nNrzm.content: The output tells how many digit from the right the decimal dot should go (considering the need for a negative sign). It also tells by which power of 10 to rescale the input (before truncating to int)

S1ilnESGQ.content: Error if the output is < 0. This happens if the Abs(IN)>=10000 or IN<=-1000

rJSIJ4SGX.description: Error if number is larger or equal to 10000, or smaller that -1000
rJSIJ4SGX.label: ERR

rklPtmBfm.description: Position of decimal point/ order of magnitude to scale
rklPtmBfm.label: OUT

@/seven-segment-display.description: Driver for 7-segment display. It supports numbers 0-9999, decimal point position and negative sign.

S1nfjLNfQ.description: Position of decimal dot, from right. Zero means no dot, 1 after frist digit..
S1nfjLNfQ.label: DOT

H1bDYtBMQ.content: Scale number, calculate position of decimal dot, and minus sign

SJCYKKrMQ.content: Display number with automatic sign, and optimal decimal dot

rydMQcHGX.content: Positive integers seven-segment display with decimal point and sign

@/seven-segment-display-auto-range.description: Correctly display floating numbers between -999 and +9999, with automatic position of decimal point and negative sign

HkLWxGHfm.content: Attempting to write a 4-digit LED display in XOD - incomplete

@/seven-segment-in-xod.description:
A single-digit seven-segment (plus decimal dot) display.
Can be used with active-high or active-low devices

HyBT157Gm.description: Set to true to display decimal dot
HyBT157Gm.label: DOT

SJF_GbNfQ.description: Input 0 for displays that are active high (source, common catode), 1 for displays that are active low (sink, common anode)
SJF_GbNfQ.label: AL

ryA6hNQZ7.content:
Select frequency with pot on shield.

Play tone by pressing button D2

We need to buffer the frequency to avoid frequency fluctuations as in test-buzzer-continuous - probably the generation of tone interferes with the reading of ADC

SyZxsO6kNbm.content:
Select frequency with pot on dev. board, connected to A3.

Play tone by pressing button D2

The tone is not stable, possibly because of interferences due to reading of A3?

@/xod-buttons.description: Same as the buttons node from the dox/lcd-button-shield, but using the analog-read node. Recognises the button pressed in a Arduino ldc shield.
